channel.title: Is it possible
channel.description: To make it where Donators cant attack regular players? If so, How? Base is PI

item.title: Is it possible
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“kingman002, post:15, topic:373433”]sticking to my beloved delta, pi seems to have way to many problems
[PI] is the new delta (by that I mean everybody is using that one server or client)[/quote]
Yes but let’s not turn this into a debate thread please.

Anyone else have a quick-fix to this problem?

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Aintaro, post:11, topic:373433”][quote author=riku9182 link=topic=469447.msg3434284#msg3434284 date=1292626169]

yes you can, the case for attacking a player is case 73:

Now this case makes it when you click a player “attack” it actually runs into him and start attacking, now you want to disable this whn donators attack normal players.

So you should add something like this under the case 73 AKA attackplayer.java in PI:

Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex];
			if (c.member == !c2.member || !c.member == c2.member) {
			c.sendMessage("You can't attack non donators.");
			return;
			}

I just made this up very fast, It might be wrong but it should help you alot.

Like I said, I’m quite new to PI’s, So any hint’s where I should add this?

attackPlayer.java.

Btw you’ll have to declare variables.

I know in attackPlayer.java, But where do I add it?
And where do I declare variables
[/quote]

I’m on my old comp atm so I can’t open files to tell you where.

But I can tell you that you’ll have to declare your variable in player.java and you’ll have to add the piece of code about under the first line of code.[/quote]
That’s just a little bit confusing >.>
You got MSN? Maybe you can help me via there?

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible

[quote=“riku9182, post:10, topic:373433”][quote author=Aintaro link=topic=469447.msg3433950#msg3433950 date=1292594609]

yes you can, the case for attacking a player is case 73:

Now this case makes it when you click a player “attack” it actually runs into him and start attacking, now you want to disable this whn donators attack normal players.

So you should add something like this under the case 73 AKA attackplayer.java in PI:

Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex];
			if (c.member == !c2.member || !c.member == c2.member) {
			c.sendMessage("You can't attack non donators.");
			return;

I just made this up very fast, It might be wrong but it should help you alot.

Like I said, I’m quite new to PI’s, So any hint’s where I should add this?

attackPlayer.java.

Btw you’ll have to declare variables.
[/quote]
I know in attackPlayer.java, But where do I add it?
And where do I declare variables[/quote]

I’m on my old comp atm so I can’t open files to tell you where.

But I can tell you that you’ll have to declare your variable in player.java and you’ll have to add the piece of code about under the first line of code.

Read full topic

			if (c.member == !c2.member || !c.member == c2.member) {

item.title: Is it possible
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:3, topic:373433”]Just a suggestion.

If you know what you’re doing, find the bit where it says “You need to be in the Wilderness to attack this player.” and so I’m guessing you must be where it is to attack a player.

Then obviously not this, but just so you got the idea…

if (playerDonator = 1) && (playerRights = 0) {
sendMessage("You cannot attack this player.");
}

^Obviously not this because I really don’t know, but you get how it must go?[/quote]
Yeah well I’m sorta new to PI’S
So not sure >.>

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible

Then obviously not this, but just so you got the idea…

sendMessage("You cannot attack this player.");
}

^Obviously not this because I really don’t know, but you get how it must go?
